tool.name: @BINARY@
tool.description: combines Hi-C matrices of the same size
tool.command:
#for $counter, $m in enumerate($matrices): ln -s '$m' ${counter}.npz.h5 && #end for
#set $m = '" "'.join([ '%s.npz.h5' % $counter for $counter, $matrix in enumerate($matrices) ]) hicSumMatrices --matrices "$m" --outFileName ./out.npz.h5

param.label: Matrices to combine
param.help: Needs to have the same shape

tool.help:
**What it does**
``hicSumMatrix`` is combining two interaction matrices of the same size to one. This comes useful if replicates of an Hi-C experiments should be merged into one interaction matrix to increase the power of the data. It is the nature of Hi-C that real interactions cannot be distinguished from noise, especially with a low interaction count. The more interactions are given, the more likely it is that a high number of interactions are real interactions or contain at least a high amount. Therefore it is a common way to merge replicates of Hi-C experiments to increase the validity of the experiment.
